newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani cotton prices seen rising.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani cotton prices seen rising.

text.p: Pakistani cotton prices are likely to rise after Friday's weekend on demand of a good quality cotton that is in short supply owing to lower production after a pest attack, dealers said on Thursday.

The prices closed higher in the week to Thursday and are likely to rise on demand from spinners selling yarn at a higher rate in the world markets, dealer Nasim Usman at the private Karachi Cotton Association (KCA) said.
"There is a good export market of yarn at a higher price," he said.
In the kerb market, the MNH-93 variety was quoted around 2,640 rupees ($65.63) per maund (37.32 kg), Usman said.
Thursday's KCA official spot rates in rupees per maund:
